CommentBody:
On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Priority has been changed to High.

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the new comment has been added: Marius Ghiurcau:

No issue here, that is the expected behavior, this escalation can be closed.
Please check also the EPP Manual/Documentation, to my knowledge we have some examples there of how filename blacklist works. Shortly, one doesn't need wildcard added at all, just the name (or partial name). If the transferred filename is my_test_example.txt, one can block this by using in the Denylist any of these: "txt", ".txt", "example.txt", "test_example.txt", etc. There is no option to block it using "test" in the Filename Denylist. Still, if the customer insists on a solution, this can be achieved by adding "test" in the Predefined Content tab. The EPP client scans also filenames and theoretically it will block if "test" is added in the dictionary.¬†

[DevOps CommentId:10687167]

If the transferred filename is my_test_example.txt, one can block this by using in the Denylist any of these: "txt", ".txt", "example.txt", "test_example.txt", etc. There is no option to block it using "test" in the Filename Denylist. Still, if the customer insists on a solution, this can be achieved by adding "test" in the Predefined Content tab. The EPP client scans also filenames and theoretically it will block if "test" is added in the dictionary."

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Client.

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the new comment has been added: Hi Marius,

Thank you for the the customer was advised that they could use custom content as it applies for file names as well as content - This works.

However to point out that the example for File Name according to the examples shown in EPP UI and also instructions on the user Manual; is that if you input only the name "Example" then it should intercept file names like "Example.pdf" and "Example together with any other extension.  But entering only the name does not work.

In the test which I conducted it did not intercept "Example" with extensions, it is only when the extensions are included under deny lists then only EPP intercepts file name like "Example.xxx"

The partner also pointed this out.   Please see the screenshots which I have uploaded.

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting R&D.

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the new comment has been added: Hi Marius, thank you for your comment. 

I think what the partner and myself is pointing out is that it is not working according to the samples shown and given.  When you enter only the name then it does not intercept the file transfer.

I uploaded a zip archive "File_Name_Denylist_samples.zip" here: https://nwxcorp.sharepoint.com/sites/CustomerSupportFiles/Data/00416860

The zip archive contains the screenshots as well as the sample file that you can download from the EPP appliance when you click on the "Download sample file".  According to the User manual, samples shown and give in the EPP Console it says that you can input only the name of the file without the extension.

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the new comment has been added: Marius Ghiurcau:

@WaitingOnEngineer¬†

Hi Andre,

Yes, there is a sample file to upload there, it has some examples in it. But that one doesn't mention anything about what are the files you are testing with, which will be blocked and which will not be blocked. Am I right? You can have a filename, without extension, named just simple "example".

You've provided me a screenshot with an explanation that you've highlighted. Right under that one, there is this sentence: "You can deÔ¨Åne the content by adding the Ô¨Ålename and extension, or just the extension."

This is the most important part üòä You can either use just the extension, or filename and extension. Only the filename does not work. If the customer is not OK with this, please raise a feature request or something like this. There is nothing I can do here right now.¬†

[DevOps CommentId:10703767]

On Escalation Ticket # 00416860 the new comment has been added: Hi Marius, thank you for you message it makes perfect sense.  I will formulate this message to our partner and advise them that a feature request can be considered if end customer is not happy about our explanation and the way it works now.
This escalation can be closed now, once again thank you for your feedback.
